intro: Hermannia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and yellow stamens, typically blooming during the wet season. Hermannia angustifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
